dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tricked-out Cadillac Escalade with the windows tinted deep black rolls INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It's like a jungle sometimes, It makes me wonder how I keep from going under...'

dialogues.speaker: A1 ESCALADE
dialogues.text: passes three people doing tai chi on a bluff overlooking the ocean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Broken glass everywhere, people pissing on the stairs you know they just don't care...'

dialogues.speaker: B1 ESCALADE
dialogues.text: passes a gorgeous Labrador retriever snatching a Frisbee midair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Can't take the smell, Can't take the noise, Got no money to move out I guess I got no choice...'

dialogues.speaker: C1 ESCALADE
dialogues.text: passes two horse back riders galloping along the beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Rats in the front room, Roaches in the back...'

dialogues.speaker: D1 ESCALADE
dialogues.text: passes a gleaming mansion with a massive putting green- like lawn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Junkie's in the alley With a baseball bat...'

dialogues.speaker: E1 ESCALADE
dialogues.text: passes blonde Little Leaguers playing baseball in crisp new uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'A crazy lady, livin' in a bag, Eatin' outta garbage pails, Used to be a fag hag...'

dialogues.speaker: F1 ESCALADE
dialogues.text: passes two rich housewives clutching shopping bags from the most expensive stores on the planet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Don't push me cuz I'm close to the edge, I'm tryin', not to lose my head...'

dialogues.speaker: ESCALADE
dialogues.text: Drives through a security gate and into a gated community of brand new mansions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It's like a jungle sometimes, it makes me wonder, How I keep from goin' under...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small crowd and the press are gathered around BILL GLUCKMAN, his wife BESS (40s, lots of plastic surgery) and daughter BRENDA (11) who are on the porch of their 12,000-square-foot mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And so if you elect me governor, I promise to take care of California the same way I take care of my own family; with compassion, caring, kindness, and most of all, with an interest in everyone. My friends... (catch phrase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'California is my family!' The crowd cheers and waves "Gluckman For Governor" signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of family, I'd like to introduce my wife Bess... Bess smiles and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and my daughter, little Brenda. Brenda smiles and waves like a campaign-trail veteran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any questions? The press begins shouting questions.       Bill picks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your son? Bill is instantly flustered and TOM GIBBONS, Bill's campaign manager (African-American, but the soul of William F. Buckley) steps in front of Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for all your questions, but we've run out of... Just then the ground shakes with a frightening RUMBLE. Everyone quiets down -- is it an earthquake?   As the RUMBLE HITS again, the surface of the water in the koi pond ripples, a la Jurassic Park. Reporters look around anxiously as another RUMBLE HITS; Bill's face falls as he sees...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Escalade rolls into the driveway, hopping up and down on its amped-up hydraulics like something from Crenshaw Boulevard on a Friday night. The rear doors pop open and MOCHA (a.k.a. CHADWICK VAN PELT), dressed head to toe in hip-hop gear, steps out of the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo yo yoooo!   Listen up, y'all! He lays down a beat "human beat box"-style as MONSTER (a.k.a. MIRIAM SHAIDELBAUM) climbs out. She's big, wearing short shorts, a tight leather halter, huge hoop earrings and oversized designer sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all better chill... Next out is HADJI (a.k.a. YUSEF AMIRASLANI), a skinny Persian kid with cornrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'cuz B-Rad G about to get ill!!! The driver's door swings open, and a gleaming white of four hundred dollar, untied Nike sneaks as they      s to the pavement; we CRANE UP, PAST Nike sweats, to      B GLUCKMAN, wearing a do rag under his Nike baseball      c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! What's up all you media people?! This is B-Rad G, kickin' it real from the 'bu, represizzin'!!! Four fine white girls in bikini tops, vinyl shorts and Timberlands come out and dance behind Brad, shaking everything they've got. Reporters move in like vultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Y'all gathered here on this special occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to my pops, he's your West Coast liaison'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So show up, don't make me throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take out your purse and cough some dough up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My chickens get wit you, if you vote right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't worry y'all, cuz my girls is tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immigration, education, runaway inflation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: California ain't flowin' like old constipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vote Bill G on your election ballot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't I'm gonna hit you wit a mallot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Glucked y'all! Tom again steps in and blocks Brad from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it for today, guys, very busy schedule, thank you!! Reporters shout questions as Tom herds Bill up the steps. Two staff members hustle Brad into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Gluckman's election team (GARY, JEN, and BRETT) work the phones as Tom paces; Bill stares out the window, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're down nine points in the polls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fifteen minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And dropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the spin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called the Times and the Chronicle, they're gonna play the whole thing off as a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. I thought he was out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen, I gave you specific orders to get some handlers and keep Brad locked down until after the announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did! They flew to the ranch in Maui last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maui?! Wasn't he at the villa in South Hampton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was at the chalet in Aspen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking laptop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope... It was the compound in Bermuda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for God's sake!   Can't we -- Brad enters and Tom shuts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Pops, that was off the hizzook! I just got you another million votes right dare!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brad's pants are so baggy, they fall to his ankles, exposing his boxers. Brad pulls them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I had to show up in order for you to blow up. So I had Captain Tony fire up the Lear jizzy and booya! I'm in da hizzy, gonna be on the campaign trizzy, 24/seven, you know, kissin' babies and whatnot. Pound it! Brad holds out his fist and Bill reluctantly hits it. his way out, Brad chest-bumps Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, you've got to shut this down, now. Tell Brad he can't work with you, period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. I love his enthusiasm... It's just a little misguided. There must be something he can do for the campaign, where he can't hurt us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... phones, stuffing envelopes, making signs, something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill is at the end of a stirring speech to the Women's Organization of California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in Bill Gluckman's administration, women will have better health care, women will have better day care, and women will have better jobs! From here on in, my campaign has a new slogan!

dialogues.speaker: IN WINGS
dialogues.text: Tom signals Brad, who enthusiastically yanks a cord, and we...

dialogues.speaker: HUGE BANNER
dialogues.text: unfurls behind Bill. It is spray-painted graffiti-style, and reads: "BILL GLUCKMAN'S DOWN WITH THE BITCHES AND

dialogues.speaker: IN WINGS
dialogues.text: Brad looks on proudly; Tom closes his eyes, a migraine kicking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry mob of women chase the limo as it backs down the driveway full speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, hollow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Gluckman's down with the bitches and ho's'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was supposed to read, 'Women are first with Gluckman.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's old school. Pops, you got to keep your pimp hand strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls in.     Bill, Tom and Brad get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peep y'all later. I'ma go work on my new campaign rhyme, 'Election Erection.' It's gonna be large! Yo! I'ma start on a new sign.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He heads for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Bill. If Brad doesn't straighten up, your political career is finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Tom. I promise you, I will not lose this election over my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set up an appointment with my shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plush. Brad sits unhappily on an overstuffed couch opposite DR. FELDMAN. Bess and Bill sit off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... Bradley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you keep callin' me dat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's your name, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my slave name, a'ight?    I told you like fi'ty times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, okay... B-Rad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wassup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's play an association game. He picks up three CD's, keeping the backs to Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, B-Rad. I want you to look at these... He turns the first one around. It's an NWA CD. Next is a Snoop CD, then a Naz CD, and last is Brad's high school yearbook photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, which one doesn't belong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot. N.W.A., fool.   They broke up a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing temper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Brad, stop acting like a gang member. You're from Malibu, you live in a nice home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With nice maids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Bess, go to your happy places. Bill sits back, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are your goals, B-Rad?    What do you want out of life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be the biggest rapper dere ever was! See, I got something to say, and I need the world to hear it. I'm the shiznit. I'll buy y'all cars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. And when did you first start feeling like you were this... shiznit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, damn... way back in the day. I've had these beats in my head since I was a little shortie...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Toddler Brad (3 years old) sits on the floor, playing with a toy as GLADYS, Brad's housekeeper (African- American, thirty) vacuums, while listening to her Walkman. The PHONE RINGS, Gladys pulls off her Walkman headphones and answers the RINGING PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gluckman residence. Brad takes the headphones and pulls them over his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Bill and Bess are out of the country until December. His eyes go wide as the hip-hop gold enters his head for the first time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From then on it was hip-hop 24/seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVEN-YEAR-OLD BRAD sits alone at the table, wearing a Run DMC hat (a la "Rock Box", playing with his food. His headphones, around his neck, BLARE NWA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish those vegetables, Bradley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be excused until you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tch.   Forget y'all. REVEAL: on the table across from Brad is a video conference system. Both parents are on separate monitors -- Bess's has a sign that reads, "Paris," and Bill's reads, "Tokyo." There is a place setting in front of each monitor, as if they're dining with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we get home... sometime in the near future... you're going to be in big trouble!!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Using the remote, Brad changes the channel on his parents' monitors to "Yo MTV Raps."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm sensing, Brad, is that your parents weren't really there for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) That's ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your bar mitzvah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Bess enter with suitcases. The house is crowded with relatives and Brad's 13-year-old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazel tov, Bradley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE LOUIE, fifty and fat, with prayer shawl and yarmulke, moves past them and calls out to Brad:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the theme of your party, kid? Star Wars? Baseball? Superheroes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: THIRTEEN-YEAR-OLD BRAD dressed like Flava Flav, a big clock around his neck, looking like he's just smelled a fart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's O.P.P., bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad exits through French doors, and as we FOLLOW him OUTSIDE NAUGHTY BY NATURE'S "O.P.P." KICKS IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like we've suddenly stepped into a hard-core rap video -- big-bootied home girls in bikinis freak with clean-cut Jewish kids as the staff serve barbecue and malt liquor to the freaked-out guests. Among them, we see a 13-year-old HADJI, MONSTER, and MOCHA, all nicely- dressed for temple. Above, a huge spray-painted banner reads: "MAZEL TIZZOV B-RAD, ON HIS BAR MITZVAH!"

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bess sniffles and dabs her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bess, I'm sensing you'd like to share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-Rad, you're a wonderful son... it's just that, well --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh stop beating around the bush, Bess. What we're trying to say is, Brad, that your behavior is, well, it's an embarrassment to the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Pops, that hurts my feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but it's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be hatin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, Brad... I can't have you on the campaign any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Oh that's how it is? A'ight then. I'm Audi! I need to take a drive.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brad leaves, slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do, doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, his lack of parental guidance left Brad wide open to outside influence, allowing hip- hop culture to firmly imprint on his psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we can bring him back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) I don't know. This is the most advanced case of gangsta-phrenia I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, not gangsta-phrenia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad relaxes in a lounge chair, wearing sunglasses and sipping on a forty. Bess enters wearing a Chanel suit. She sits on the lounge chair next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley, I know you're busy, but we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad lifts his sunglasses and turns to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After our therapy session I realized that your father and I could have been better parents. We neglected you and I feel terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALIBU'S MOST WANTED - Rev. 8/22/02 (2nd Pink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  So from here on out I'm going to be a better mother. I want to get closer to you... be there for you. If ever you need --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, her CELL PHONE RINGS.         She pulls it out her hip and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Celeste! When did you get back?! What?! Oh my God! I've been waiting for that bag for six months! (to Brad, covering phone) It's my personal shopper. (back to phone) Stay right there. I'm on my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... where we... Oh yes. I'm always here for you, Bradley. Do you have my cell number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Brad a piece of paper and exits. Brad pulls down his shades and takes a long sip from his forty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad sits at the massive dining room table as Gladys pour him a big glass of grape juice, then cuts up his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever feel like you don't belong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time, baby. Most folks only feel comfortable around folks who are the same as them. When they meet someone different, they get scared and angry, wanna keep 'em down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' to do but keep it real. Be proud of who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you right... Gladys, when they gonna leave our people alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional) I don't know, baby, I just don't know... (notices Brad's plate) Eat your greens before they get cold, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAGER GOES OFF. Brad searches his pockets, pulls out a pager -- that's not it; pulls out another pager -- that's not it either; pulls out a two-way -- that's the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading pager) Oh no, not again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Tom, the staff, and several AIDES of varying ethnicity are mid-meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go with Feldman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great news. If he sees Brad five days a week, he says we'll see improvement in three to four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... the election's in two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been brainstorming on some different approaches, and I think we may have something solid here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team gathers around -- it's a gang pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad might act 'ghetto,' but let's face it, he's never been east of Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if we give him a little dose of reality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him get a firsthand look at the ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, have Brad actually... go there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds dangerous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be perfectly safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hire actors to play gangsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They car-jack Brad,     then take him on a 'tour' of the     'hood... give him a little taste     of what thug life's really like.      It might just scare the black out     of him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tom gets strange looks from everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm as down as the next brother, guy... fellah. I grew up in Compton, okay? But let's get over the P.C. thing and face facts. Unless we do something soon, Brad's gonna cost us this election.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team all nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... it sounds so drastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe drastic is what Brad needs, Bill. He is twenty-four. I mean, what's he gonna do for a living, rap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all chuckle.     Bill sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do we get for the gangsters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the anti-crime spot we shot last month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got it cued up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to the TV and Gary hits PLAY. On the monitor:     A Gluckman campaign ad plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young, black gangbanger (SEAN), glares at camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For too long, street violence has torn Californians apart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second banger (PJ), glares at camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Gluckman wants to put our divisions behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut wide: to reveal Bill Gluckman standing in between the two gangbangers. He's in shirtsleeves, tie loosened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas, instead of thinking of yourselves as what set you're from, or what crew you're rolling with, why can't you both be brothers. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we never thought of each other like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither, dawg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PJ and Sean think is over, nod and shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see... (turning to camera) 'California is my family'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to angle on Bill and the gangbangers playing basketball, having a wonderful time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we work together as a family there's no telling how high we can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill flies by, obviously from an O.S. trampoline, and soars over the gangbangers for a monster dunk. Freeze on:     the two awestruck "gangbangers."

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As they talk we see Brad, out the window, raising a banner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are our guys, right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he be safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fed up and confused) I don't know... can't we just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the window and sees Brad's new banner. reads, in graffiti colors: "ELECTION ERECTION."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, fine, just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad urgently runs into the Mali-Brew Coffee Shop (Starbucks clone), where he and his crew spend ninety percent of their time. He is stopped at the door by a very worried Mocha and Monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to see him like dis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He O.D.'d again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you stop him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried, yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like twelve, thirteen, I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Twelve Frapachizzo's. Brotha's caffeined out. Move aside.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brad pushes past and looks on in horror at Hadji, pacing and talking to himself like a rabid dog on angel dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'ma get mine! Step, fool!   I'll cut you, I swear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just chill, Hadji, we're here to help. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frenzied) I... I... I was pickin' up aromatherapy candles at Illuminations for Moms, right? And the counter trick gave me lemon when I specifically axed for lilac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad turns to Hadji.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC:   PUBLIC ENEMY'S "Fight The Power" KICKS IN as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad, followed by his crew, exit, ready for battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still listening to     "FIGHT THE POWER," only now a Muzac version, piped in     through the mall's PA SYSTE Brad, Hadji, Monster and     Mocha strut through the mall Rich shoppers get out of     the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad and his crew approach the OLD WOMAN CASHIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, fool! We got some hard-core drama 'bout to go down right neow!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dat's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dis is our mall. Always was and always will be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woof woof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mr. Amiraslani. I'm so glad you came back. Our clerk accidentally gave you the wrong aromatherapy candles. Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Hadji a box marked "Lilac."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be validatin' my parking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dat's what I'm talkin' 'bout.    We get ours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, standing by a limo, is speaking with Sean and PJ, dressed as their actual, preppy selves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Hold the phone, buddy... you want us to scare this kid until he starts acting like a nice little white boy again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I can handle it. I studied at Juilliard for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom hands them a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's some background information on Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PJ pulls Brad's CD from the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: CD COVER
dialogues.text: It is Brad, throwing the Malibu sign, surrounded by women in thongs with gigantic asses. The title, in graffiti font, reads: "MALI-BOOTAY!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malibootay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He considers himself a 'rapper.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frickin' A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.        Tom hands them a checklist/itinera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so here's the story -- it's your basic kidnapping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we hold him for ransom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   But when you see   him acting ghetto and all, it    pisses you off  so much, you tour   him around the 'hood to show    him what things are really like. (hands PJ a list) I had my guys brainstorm    a few ideas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading list) 'Mugging, drive-by shooting, crack deal gone bad...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you have him steal some watermelon while you're at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pays fifteen grand apiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) We're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- we're kidnapping him, couldn't we get arrested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you covered. Mr. Gluckman's a billionaire -- if you run into any problems with the law, we're very close with the commissioner. On the flip side, if you screw up and a single hair is touched on Bradley's over-privileged head, I will make sure that you do serious time. Clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris... tal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls out a smaller envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five up front, twenty-five when you return him to us, white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... As the driven snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom gets in the limo and leaves as Sean and PJ head for their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats, my brother.   We just booked another gig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's totally dangerous, dude. You know what it's like in the 'hood. We could get shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can handle ourselves. Come on, man, it's the ultimate acting challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what really chaps  my ass? After years of training and  study, the only parts they'll give  us are gangbangers. Just once I'd   like to play a character who has  decent grammar and doesn't wear Timberlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats gettin' dunked on by Bill Gluckman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we even know anybody down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think, then come up with it at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra.

dialogues.speaker: SHONDRA
dialogues.text: in a Wienie In a Bun uniform, chewing gum and looking like she's smelling something nasty.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's at the counter facing Sean and PJ.     PJ studies t menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You zooted, nigga?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the stupidest thing I ever heard. I got better things to do with my time, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like work at Wienie In A Bun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. You're the one always talkin' about improvin' yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am improvin' myself, fool. I broke up with no-good gang-bangin' Tec, I'm going to beauty school, then I'ma hook up my own salon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, how about hooking a brother up with a Pepsi and some fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do this, Shondra. You'll get some real money so you can quit this minimum wage crap and start up your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you payin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it trey, we on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, three grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you can kiss my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.   Now how about those fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC:   An UPTEMPO RAP TRACK KICKS IN as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean sits on a second-hand couch in their barren, low- rent apartment, concentrating on reading an Ebonics dictionary. PJ enters from outside, sweating and carrying a heavy box marked: "JOHN'S PROP HOUSE." He wears a stylish Nike baseball cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're strapped now, my brother. He sets the box down and begins pulling out guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have everything we ordered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glocks, Uzis, Tec-9s... PJ takes off the cap to wipe his brow, revealing that his hair has been braided into cornrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my hair? Shondra just did it. (off Sean's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You hate it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just think it's a choice my character would have made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go there, Sean. You're just jealous you didn't think of it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Sean enters with a big box marked "THUG LIFE." He has on a wig identical to Larenz Tate's braids and beads in Menace II Society.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, got the gangsta wear.

dialogues.speaker: A22 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PJ bursts into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wig, man! I didn't know this was Halloween. Bring me back some candy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doubles over, falling on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean yanks the wig off and whips it into the corner.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: PJ has on baggy jeans. Sean yanks them down so his boxers are hanging out. PJ smiles -- perfect.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: PJ and Sean, now in full gangsta gear, practice their pimp struts...

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ stand side by side in front of a full-length mirror, practicing making angry faces and pulling guns from their pants, as we...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: His face filled with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme your ride, punk, or I will dust yo ass!

dialogues.speaker: A22 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WIDEN to reveal PJ watching Sean, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, you're not convincing me. Remember your core character. You're an oppressed black man from the ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, I'm having trouble finding this one. Lemme try it again.  Gimme your ride, punk, or I will dust yo ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Add a 'beeyotch' and I think you're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: the MUSIC SEGUES from our MONTAGE RAP BEAT TO Mocha's HUMAN BEAT BOX, as we...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: as a car door opens, boots hit the pavement, and Shondra's incredibly fine ass slides INTO FRAME. FOLLOW it as it moves to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra enters, looking ghetto fab hot. People look at her like she just landed from Mars. She raises her sunglasses, sees Brad and crew playing dominoes at a table. Brad slaps down the winner; points at Monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thin to win! (raps to Monster) 'The name is B-Rad, Not Robbie Van Winkle... Go get my latte nonfat, And don't forget the sprinkle!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pound and congratulate Brad on his      brilliance. Shondra drops her shades back down and      moves in. Had sees her first. His jaw drops, then he       tugs on Moch shirt, whose jaw drops, then Mocha tugs      on Brad's sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, what up, fool?   I'm --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brad sees Shondra and freezes.      Everything goes SLOW MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: SHONDRA
dialogues.text: strutting toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl you fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get them tig ol' bitties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws open her shirt, and before we see anything we...

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: His eyes go wide, then we're... BACK TO REAL TIME: Brad snaps to as Shondra brushes by and then moves to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall, Grande, Venti, nonfat, soy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big... (pointed) ...black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barista) Yo, Krista the Barista. Put it on my account. (to Shondra) Get yourself a blueberry scizonne too, girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool, playa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.     Brad follows her over to the condiment table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't seen you in here before. Where you reside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compton.   You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which streets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malibu... Represent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bard throws the "M" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I guess it's pretty hardcore up in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. (points to his crew) I'm down with the P.C.H. Hustlers. And dems over dere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad points to three white wannabes in another corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Calabasis Crabs... and behind dem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN TO another table, where four thug posers sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the Palaside Pimps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.   How do you deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All day every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles seductively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that you droppin' rhymes when I came in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, I'm a rhyma on tima...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad hands her his CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mali-boo-tay, huh? Looks phat. You gettin' any air play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holdin' out for Power 106. I sent Big Boy a CD, he just ain't gotten back to me yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds just like that fat fool. I'll talk to him 'bout it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blown away) Hold dup? You know Big Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. I see him at the swap meet almost every Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For rizzill?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For rizzeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo.    Holler at him for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess you do kinda got it goin' on... It's funny. I was just on my way down to see him. Wanna roll with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? (thinks) Well, tonight was my Seder dinner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just helping out a brotha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kisses Chai) Let's bounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna hit the ladies' room, a'ight, pimp juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads off.      Brad turns to his posse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, y'all, this fine dimey is hookin' me up with Big Boy hisself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't lyin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pound, shake, hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, but what about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start droppin' beats. Soon as I sign with Biggy, we gonna need some sick tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all pound as Mocha starts throwing beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra's on her Nextel cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean listens to Shondra on his Nextel, then looks at PJ and nods gravely.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: They drive along the Santa Monica Freeway, heading east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you rap about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I can rap about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, lemme kick it freestyle. (raps) 'Traffic, traffic, Lookin' for my Chap Stick, Feelin' kinda carsick, There's a Ford Maverick...' (back to talking) See? Dat's a million-dollar song right dare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how did you get to be so down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been a playa all my life, girl. And I must say, of all the sisters I been wit', you de finest. So, you got a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter) I did, but I just got through kickin' his sorry ass to the curb. I ain't nobody's 'gangsta hoochie.' I am an entrepreneur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word. (then) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A businesswoman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day I'ma have a chain of beauty salons all up in the 90210, just like Starbucks, only instead of coffee, with hair and nails. Makin' sick money turnin' all the rich hoochies ghetto fab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's genius, girl. Damn. You fine and smart too. You gonna blow up huge, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's taken aback by his sincerity.      She doesn't get validation from guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real, girl. You like a cross between Martha Stewart and Oprah. I'ma call you Mothrah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a strange look, then notices where they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad swerves across three lanes of the freeway to take the exit, and suddenly finds himself actually in South Central. He's awestruck -- he notices a homeless guy with a shopping cart loaded with bags of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. He really should use delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Sean pops his head into the car and stares directly at Brad. He puts a prop Tec 9 in Brad's chest and yanks him out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme yo ride, punk, or I will dust yo ass... beeyotch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gettin' jacked!   Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dis a come-up?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    It's a stickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm about to wet you up if you don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly) Does this mean we're not going to Big Boy's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Boy's?    What this fool talkin' about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jus' been kidnapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw Brad in the car and get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnapped?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We got your rich Gluckman ass now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw you on the news the other night! (mocking) B-Rad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your papa's gonna pay or you're gonna pay!

dialogues.speaker: A25 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brad sneaks out his two way and types in...

dialogues.speaker: TWO-WAY
dialogues.text: as Brad's frantic message pops on: "911! 911! I BEEN CAR JACKED! HELP! B-RAD!" A hand slaps a domino violently down next to the pager as we...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Monster has just slammed down the winner, and the PAGER with Brad's message flies off the table and SHATTERS on the floor. Monster, Mocha and Hadji are unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bam! Y'all owe me seven hundred dollars!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hadji reluctantly hands her a wad of cash as she laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, come on now, let's stop messing around. B told us to lay down some beats for the new album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme go free style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free style, please! Your momma rap better than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you talk about my momma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk about your momma all I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't got the bizalls, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Peep dis. Your momma's so poor, when she shops at Barneys, she has to drive herself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well your momma's so poor, when she went to Monte Carlo, she flew commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your momma's so poor, her round the world cruise ended in Spain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your momma's so poor, when she stayed at the Four Seasons, she could only afford three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh damn, it's on now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ESCALADE pulls into Shondra's driveway and SCREECHES to a stop. PJ hauls Brad out of the back as Sean climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang. Why you doin' this to a brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours, y'all.    I'm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down?    God damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.    You done did it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not black! You can never be black. And your perpetratin' ass is stealin' the only thing I got -- my culture!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell makes you think you know what's goin' down in the 'hood?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B.E.T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is a joke, wigga?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   Don't be hatin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a long way from the beach now, punk! You in South Central. The ghetto. The 'hood. It's hard core up in here! People here die every day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two LITTLE GIRLS are walking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Shondra! Can you come on by later? Princess just had her litter of puppies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Brad looking puzzled by this; waving) Okay then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) They're pit bulls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean pit bulls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get ya ass inside.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ push Brad in. Bars are on the windows.     Se pats Brad down, and pulls out his pager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anything else on you, fool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... just this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad pulls out another pager, a phone, another phone. Sean and PJ both pull several more out of his other pockets, as well as his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that James Bond electronic crap can't save you now, fool. Sit ya ass down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad does, and PJ duct-tapes his hands behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna go call yo daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better pray he home. If he not, you're one dusted trick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, PJ and Shondra exit, slamming the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ immediately drop their bad-ass personas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you buy my rage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're indicating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm indicating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating) 'I will smoke your dumb wigga ass'? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating back) 'If he not, you're one dusted trick!' Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you two fools shut the hell up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Shondra, sorry. You're on. Go play good cop. We've gotta call Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra rolls her eyes and heads back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra enters.      Brad turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a'ight in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. I just been kidnapped, carjacked, hands tied behind my back, but other than that, it's all good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry about all that, it wasn't my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you liked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come you set me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to. They... (emotional) ... they threatened to kill me if I didn't play along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed) For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.   They straight-up killas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even more wide-eyed) For Real?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme school you on something, help you to stay alive, a'ight? The one thing they hate more than anything, that really sets them off, is posers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel you, girl, me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talkin' 'bout you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? But I hate posers! I got a Ph.D. -- a Poser-Hater Degree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Quit frontin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't fron'in'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to reason. If you just be a nice little white boy and say you're sorry, I think I can convince them to let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. I am who I say I am. Why won't anyone believe me? This is a issue that's been comin' up a lot in my life lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra exits, shakes her head "no" to Sean and PJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PJ refers to the itinerary they got from Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about... number three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, perfect. Let's take it to another level, my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and PJ "get into character" and head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter and glare at Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, we put the call in to yo pops, and you know what he said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he'd have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What?   Straight up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not sure he wants you back, cuz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see as I blame him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, y'all, quit hatin'.   I'm just a rapper, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wigga please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean cuts the duct tape with a blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doin', fool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'ma teach this little white girl a lesson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dawg, stick to the plan. Lay low here at the crib 'til we get the ransom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plan just done changed, Tree. Wannabe claims he down, I'ma show him just how un-down he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean yanks Brad out by his collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean pulls in and parks in front of a small Korean grocery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, Malibu, go get us six 40s of O.E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a fifth of Henny. (to Sean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like some Pringles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't a picnic, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry... y'all got some duckets, 'cause I'm tapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You about to go up in there and give this Korean bitch yo ends? Hell no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jack that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if the Asiatic gives you any static, show the brotha this... He hands Brad one of the prop guns -- a Glock.    It's heavier than Brad thought. He drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little trick claims he down, can't even swing a gat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, punk, or I'll use that on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, a'ight, I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try to get away, I'ma let you get a little taste of my steel, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up his prop gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad sticks the prop gun into his pants and gets out. soon as he's in the store, Sean and PJ burst into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna run out of there a scared little white boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh again and pound it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad walks in, very nervous.       He looks back -- his c parked so that PJ can see him      through the door. PJ smiles and shows him the gun      again. Brad swallows an approaches the counter. The       KOREAN GUY behind it wa him closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh, where the Old English at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back there, under security camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad hurries to the back of the store, and spots a door by the beer cooler. He tries to open it. It's locked. Brad looks up to the security mirror and sees that the Korean Guy is watching him. He moves to the beer cooler and tries to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Namyoho renge kyo, namyoho renge kyo, namyoho renge kyo and whatnot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not working. Brad tries a cleansing         breath. doesn't help either. Brad gathers up an         armful of English 40s and heads for the front. The         Korean G watches him as he walks past the counter        toward th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naaw, but I'ma help myself to all this O.E., and whatever else I want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad drops the beer. It CRASHES to the floor in SLOW MOTION. Brad makes a crazy, threatening face as he pulls back a fist, but the Korean Guy throws a fast right hand, landing squarely on Brad's chin. Brad goes down like a sack of hammers; then we FLASHBACK TO: Moments earlier: We realize we've just been in a fantasy, as Brad again approaches the counter with his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Let me axe you something.   Ever been robbed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure. Last week was my fifty- fourth time. But they were cool, no gun to head, never scream; you know, good people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets the 40s on the counter, then reaches into his waistband for his gun, and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did you have to give this guy, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you set this thing up yesterday, what did you pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you set it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the owner doesn't know this is all fake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in there!    He could get shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going in there!    You go in there! They continue to argue as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad finishes reaching into his waistband for the Glock, but feels something else. He pulls out a small wallet that was Velcroed to his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My emergency stash.    Thank you God. He pulls out a hundred and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you got cash, 'cause if you try to jack me, I was gonna have to lay you out wid dis...

dialogues.speaker: B38 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He whips a .44 from under the counter and aims it at Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and wid dis. The Korean Guy's wife has an AK-47 on Brad, the red dot of its laser sight trained steadily in the middle of his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And wid dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Korean Guy's six-year-old boy has a sawed-off shotgun pointed at Brad's knees. The gun is bigger than the boy. The Koreans laugh at Brad. Brad drops the hundred on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ringing it up) Thank you very much. Come again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brad looks out to make sure PJ and Sean haven't seen anything, the Korean Guy sticks the receipt in between two of the 40s. Unaware, Brad gathers his stuff and heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I know this is gonna sound wack, but what I'm about to do is just a joke, so don't shoot me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ, who are just running up to the door, watch stunned as Brad exits the store, pulling his gun out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! Next time I'll bust a cap in yo trick ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he actually do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still shouting) Yeah. I'ma come back later and get some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad turns to the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's dip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight up.   Trick didn't do nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, what up with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PJ pulls the receipt off of his 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you jacked this, how come you got a receipt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad freezes.     They both stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stole that too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Tom lie facedown on matching massage tables, while massage therapists rapidly pound their backs.

dialogues.speaker: TOM'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Tom is reading the itinerary through the face hole in his table. As the masseuses pound their backs, Tom and Bill's voices vibrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a meet and greet with Greenpeace, then drinks with the offshore oil lobby.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: face through hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.   How's the Brad project doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smooth... he's in South Central.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in excellent hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, holding Brad by the shirt, slams him against the Escalade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've about had it, boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you callin' boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got about five seconds to get real, or I'ma Timbo stomp your ass to de curb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, get real?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Act your white self!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves a prop gun into Brad's ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five!   Four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking) Okay, a'ight, chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad takes a deep sigh, looks them in the eye, and begins to talk like a conservative white guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I now know I can never be as cool as you guys. I promise I will never, ever front or act like a thug again, and I'm really really sorry if I offended you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ move off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You buying it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's give him the test.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Brad, in the seats, eating popcorn non-stop. He is flanked by Sean and PJ... They both watch Brad, as he stares at the horror film play on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Brad's look) You a'ight, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad snaps out of it for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("white" guy) Great, fine. Terrific popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARY MUSIC    KICKS IN; Brad's eyes snap back to the screen. He     struggles to contain himself. The MUSIC INTENSIFIES,    we hear FOOTSTEPS, then a DOOR HANDLE TURNING, and    Brad can't hold on any longer. He leaps u screaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as himself) Run, bitch, ruuuuuuuuuuuuuun!!! He gonna kiiiiiilllllll you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Patrons (multi-ethnic) turn and angrily "shush" Brad. Sean and PJ lock eyes: he failed the test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ are furious.     Brad is apologetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, y'all, but this is just who I am. I'm a rapper straight- up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wigga, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, for real. I can rap about anything. (goes into rap) 'Bloodbath and Tree, hang all day, They real tight, but they ain't gay... No, they okay...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incensed) You think you got mad skills, huh? Well, we'll see about dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, PJ, and Brad approach the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I done had it with you, fool. You better check yourself before you wreck yourself. This ain't Malibu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Represent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we gonna see what you represent neeow. We at the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cube, Snoop, they all came up through here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to prove yourself, this the place to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shove Brad into the club, then turn to each other and giggle like school girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is definitely gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pound and follow Brad into the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad enters and takes in the club. Think 8 Mile. Hardcore GANGSTER TYPES and some tough HOME GIRLS check out rapper, DROP, whose ferocious, gravel-voiced raps show you exactly what kind of place you're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feelin' now, Malibu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, a place where I feel at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Get yo' ass in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad boldly fist-shakes jaw-dropped patrons as he wades through the crowd, AD LIBBING "Whassup?" and "Pardon me, homey."

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: DROP finishes and the MC brings up STEEL and YOUNG DRE, announcing the Battle Rap Competition. Steel and Young Dre battle -- both are top-notch. At every insult, the crowd ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: A45 ON BALCONY
dialogues.text: Shondra is    talking to a HOME GIRL, checking out the cr below. She     suddenly sees Brad. She's eyes-wide horrified.     Steel finishes, the crowd CHEERS, and Youn Dre starts    in on the mic.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ leave Brad and fight through to the DJ table, where the MC is standing, timing Young Dre. Brad looks around, then up.     He sees Shondra and start for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, girl.    Where you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and faces TEC, her ex-boyfriend, a no-nonsense roughneck gangbanger. He's very soft-spoken, almost expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your damn bizness, Tec. Now let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks her arm away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all been busy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too busy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been gettin' busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, girl, I'm cool.    Just tell me who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you need to know is that it ain't you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you ain't shit, Shondra. You're just a chickenhead, and that's all you'll ever be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Brad walks up, grinning like a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up, girl?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a sloppy kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a'ight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, but you the finest! (to Tec) She a genius too, man! I'm tellin' you, one she gets set up, Mothra gonna blow up like Rosie O'Donnell's head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you been hittin' that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to pull away, but Tec holds on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, man. Don't you know how to treat a lady? That's not nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad, don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool, Shondra.      The brutha's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec releases Shondra's arm and immediately grabs Brad by the throat and hangs him over the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't yo mama teach you to mind you own bizness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (being strangled) Don't be hatin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Tec!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auuuuuuuuu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec feels everyone looking at him. Now is not the time. He releases Brad and composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all both gonna be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec stalks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughs) I'm okay. Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old history.   Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra grabs Brad and moves him to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: B45 AT THE DJ TABLE
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ finally make it to the MC, who stands with the DJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean bumps the DJ table. A vicious look from the DJ, as Sean tries to play it off. The MC just looks at him disdainfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... My boy want Young Dre next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC looks them over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, nah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a C-Note would open some... equal opportunities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes the cash) What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-rad.   From Malibu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC makes a face, but puts down Brad's name anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) Hey playa... You got any Will Smith back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC just looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 47

dialogues.speaker: A47 SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Shondra hauls Brad down the stairs and stops near the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn Shondra, where's the fire at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fishing in her bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You settin' me free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm savin' your ass. I'm not havin' your blood on my hands. (hands him keys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the blue Honda across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-ight y'all. Up next, to challenge Young Dre, we got... B- rad from Malibu. Looks of confusion, as the Crowd searches for "B-rad."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. Brad, don't do it. Brad turns to Shondra, looks at the keys, and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra, I gots to do 'dis. this is my shot. I gotta prove myself. Shondra can't argue. Brad starts to the stage. A WAVE OF SHOCK, as the crowd realizes who B-rad actually is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be like an episode of 'Oz.' Brad gets his game face on and walks the gauntlet on his way to the stage -- an imposing path of intimidating looks.

dialogues.speaker: A47 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is then dragged up onto the stage. He misinterprets the ANTAGONIZING CHANTS as encouragement and tries to high-five the crowd -- no takers. The MC and Young Dre laugh at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, nah, nah... I ain't gonna battle no bitch. What am I? Ike Turner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd LAUGHS.     Brad cluelessly laughs along with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-ight, a-ight... We gotta do this. Yo, Saltine... Heads or tails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tizzaizzlszzs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic) Tails... I want tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC flips and "tails" it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah... Ladies first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad LAUGHS, turning to the crowd to appreciate his lame burn... Nothing. Young Dre looks furious. Young Dre grabs the mic and the DJ spins. Young Dre proceeds to incinerate Brad. With every line, the crowd goes insane. (NOTE: Actual Young Dre Rap to Come.) As Young Dre flows, Brad is visibly shaken, but tries to play it off -- not so discreetly scribbling notes on his hand and up his arm. Young Dre finishes with devastating blow, dropping the mic on the stage. The crowd goes wild...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whooo... GOD DAMN! Now, let's see if this Eminem melts in yo ass and in your hand.

dialogues.speaker: A47 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The DJ kicks the beat and the MC throws Brad the mic. He misses it and it drills him in the forehead. The crowd LAUGHS. Brad tries to regain his composure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we start again?   I lost my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAUNTS and LAUGHS as the beat plays again. Brad wags his head, ready to come in strong. He looks down at his notes... He's sweating so badly his arm is a mess of runny ink. He freezes again... The crowd is really on him now -- collectively making the "choke" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool... I'm cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad finally starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'You big and rough, You act all tough, I bet in your childhood You never had much love. (finishing) Alert the media, I'm a rap encyclopedia, My shrink says I suffer from a case of gansta-phrenia, I'm tryin' to be meania, I'm feeling much vigor, I'm the "Bu's" number one, hardcore NIGGAA!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified, to SEAN) Let's get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad looks around as blank faces stare back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts with outrage and rushes the stage.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: WAILS with terror as he's passed hand-over-hand above the CURSING CLUB PATRONS, (crowd surfing-style) toward the exit. Four THUGS run Brad out of the back door, into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where they launch him into the dumpster with a resounding THUD. Brad's landing causes the lid to SLAM violently shut, and forces Sean and PJ, who've been hiding behind it, to pop up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? A RUMBLE comes from the dumpster and they pull back the lid. ANGLE ON: Inside the dumpster where Brad lies in the bottom -- his fall was broken by several loaves of old Wonder Bread. PJ and Sean fall into hysterics, as Shondra emerges from the club. She finds PJ and Sean apoplectic with laughter, shakes her head and begins to help Brad out of the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: BY BAR
dialogues.text: Tec watches it all going down. SNUFFY, 20, skinny but tough-looking chollo, and not a member of Tec's crew, is standing next to Tec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gettin' played, ese.
