dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Loco boy hittin' your lady, homes, and she's diggin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Snuffy, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tec starts to laugh, then suddenly his fist explodes into Snuffy's face. Snuffy drops, and Tec starts to stomp him until his boys, 8-BALL and DEUCE, pull him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here, Tec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, y'all, let's roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchoo wanna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bag me a white boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move toward the exit we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ are laughing uproariously. Brad walks in between them, devastated. Shondra's behind, looking bummed out as they head for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey y'all, check this out. I can rap about anything! Haaa!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word. (bad white rapping) 'Listen, all you rappers, the name's Brad Gluckman. When on the mic you could say I really suck man!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst out laughing. Brad just stares ahead, pouting, sick to his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, y'all had your fun, why don't you chill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cuz B-Rad G about to get ill!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst out laughing again as they head for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. I haven't laughed like that in a long time. 'Fess up, boy, you can't hang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhn uhn, ain't happening. By the way, forgot to tell you. We heard from your pops, and guess what? He ain't payin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks y'all belong down here in the 'hood with us brothas, seein' how you so 'down' and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess that means we got to ice your punk ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care no more. I got nothin' to live for. Go ahead and smoke me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad gets in the car. Sean and PJ look at each other -- this isn't what they expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NOTE:    Scene A50 was formerly scene 54) Brad's lying on the bed, looking up dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psst.   Hey, dawg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here, dawg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad looks over the edge of the bed.       A small gray R looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart Little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negro, pleeeze. That little white rat ain't got nothin' on me -- yo, I'm Ronny rizat, represizzat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't never seen no talking rat before. Although at the Malibu County Fair they had a chicken that played tic tac toe. Man, I hated losing to that chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you so down, dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, nah it's not like that. You need to stop listening to what all them perpetrators is running and believe in yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For riz-real.    Pound it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They punch it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you saying if I put my mind to it I can be whatever I want to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be a highstylin' pimp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stylin-est.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could drive a mad '63 El Camino with 43-inch gold-plated dubs and a trunk full o' bitches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALIBU'S MOST WANTED - Rev. 1/29/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have a roof rack full of bitches. And some teeny-tiny little bitches in the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I could be the biggest rapper in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapper? Hell no! You stink! I'd rather eat garbage than listen to your tired ass rhymes. (thinks about it) Hmmm, garbage. That's making me hungry. Peace out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rat runs off. Brad sighs, flops back down on the bed, utterly depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad lays on the bed, moonlit through the bars of the window. Shondra enters. Brad rolls over, away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...   You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad sniffles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's not as bad as it seems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worse. Everybody's right. My rhymes is weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need a little experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've run when you gave me the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. You were right. I respected you for getting' up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you heard 'em laughing.   I ain't nothin' but a busta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just don't understand you. None of them know how hardcore it is up in... Malibu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perking up) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah with the... traffic, and the... parking, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting excited) Like, when the public be all up in your private beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. You just got to stick with it, you know, don't let anyone tell you who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad smiles, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Shondra. (beat) You know what I was sayin', earlier, in the car, about being a playa and all? Well... I was just foolin'. I never been with a sister before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock surprise) For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for on the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never would've known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shy) I think you about the finest girl I ever met in my whole life, and, well, since they gonna ice me in the morning, I was wondering... could I, kinda like, kiss you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks, smiles, then sits down next to him on the bed. Brad sits up and looks at her face in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad leans in and kisses her tenderly. She kisses him back. Encouraged, Brad opens his mouth wide and tries to stick his tongue down her throat. She pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said kiss, fool. Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I offered you a snack, not the whole kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I'm sorry.   I'm chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls her eyes and leaves. Brad falls back on the bed, a dreamy smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec, with his crew, drives up, lights out, and KILLS the ENGINE. He looks at the house with death in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra exits the room and faces Sean and PJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, that's it, this game is lame. I want my money, and then y'all can get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're not done yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't never gonna be done. Did it ever occur to you two jackasses that this is the way he really is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Look, I did what you asked, and I want my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll get it, you know, but settin' everything up was expensive, and I don't exactly have it right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?   You playin' me? Shondra hands Sean the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all get me my money now, or I'ma go in there and tell him what's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, okay, just relax... As Sean starts to dial, we --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sean. How's our little project going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, terrific, we're making real progress here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean reads from the checklist Tom gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your suggestions were really helpful. He totally bought the car jack and kidnapping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad listens intently as Sean continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we staged a fabulous liquor store robbery. Mr. Gluckman's going to be very happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, he's still posing, so we wanted to put him in a drive-by shooting next... but, it's a little more money then our original projections...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad slumps back.     He can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I was wondering if I could get an advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No deal. You get the rest when Richie Cunningham steps through the door here, and not one second sooner, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- Mr. Gibbons, hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad crawls out from the vent and goes to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... they been playin' me all along. How could dey do dat? How could she do dat? (getting angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-ever. If them fools wanna play, then let's play. He heads for the door, bad-ass and hardcore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Brad's boot comes through the door. WOOD SHATTERS everywhere. Brad steps through with a furious look on his face. Shondra, Sean and PJ stare in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Listen up... Brad G is in da hiz, and things gonna start changin' round here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be out yo mind. Get back in that room before I beat your ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feelin' froggy, den leap! Sean backs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else wanna step?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly attracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell got into you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you callin' ho, ho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, ho, the same ho that gave up that weak-ass kiss five minutes ago in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off) Who the hell do you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm B-Rad G, from 'Bu, representin'! What y'all don't realize is that I was tryin' to put my mobbin' days behind me, but rollin' with y'all done re-awoke my inna killa. Let's start droppin' bodies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra, PJ and Sean watch, stunned, as Brad grabs a prop gun, his car keys and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, girl. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhn uhn. You created that monster, you deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we got big a problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I see my money, it's your problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ exit quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's at the car door as Sean and PJ exit and run up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to take a drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man.    Chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today is a good day to die, didn't have to use my A.K... (Ice Cube-like) Yey yey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you talkin' crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in car) Might as well go out in a blaze of glory.  My daddy don't love me, my rhymes is played. I ain't down enough for y'all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) No.   You down, right PJ, er, Tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Bloodbath, he's very down. As down as they come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Tec jumps up, yanks Brad's door open and shoves a Nine in his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car, white boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you dat weak fuck from de club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec can't believe what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not impressed) Got somethin' for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling a Tec 9) Just this cap, fool! You ready to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that a coinky-dink? I was just talkin' to my homies about just dat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out of car) A'ight, but y'all should change up your style, cuz these jackings is gettin' tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for Tec's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Bloodbath, if there's one tiny scratch on my ride, I'ma eat y'all's children. (cheerfully) Shotgun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tape up this fool's hole, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crew member yanks out some duct tape and tapes over Brad's mouth, then they throw him in Tec's trunk and slam it shut. Tec steps up to Sean and PJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should we do with this Bloodbath and his friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) I'm not Bloodbath! My real name is Sean James, I'm an actor. I swear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Shondra hittin' the white boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. She's in on the scam, just like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We're all being paid to pretend to kidnap Bill Gluckman's kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gluckman?   The dude runnin' for Governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dawg who's down with bitches and hoes? Hell yeah, I've heard of him. Just 'cause I live down here you think I'm ignorant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't say that, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight then. (looks at Brad) Damn, we got Gluckman's son. Fool's gotta be worth more alive than dead. (to his crew) Let's roll.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and the campaign strategy team, Brett, Gary and Jen, are eating takeout, mid-meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the polls say that since Brad's been out of the picture we're up six points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still dead in the urban demo, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gays too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way we can win without them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INTERCOM RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a Sean on the phone for you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean is on a pay phone, terrified. Tec stands next to him. The Escalade and Tec's car are parked nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, we have a real problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, no more money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you said that, but we're in real serious troub --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec rips the phone out of Sean's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, fool. Gluckman's boy has been kidnapped for real, along with your punk friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Mr. Governor wants to see his punk bitch son alive again I'm gonna need five hundred grand by tomorrow midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know this is real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think your actors are this good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec puts the phone up to Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us, please... (hiccup) I'm... (hiccup) so... (hiccup) Scared!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean begins to wail.      Tec yanks the phone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Now get me my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine... Please don't do anything until I talk to Mr. Gluckman and arrange the finances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind, no one notices as a low rider cruises by slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Snuffy, his face swollen and bloody from the beating he took from Tec. He's with two of his homeboys, members of the Rollin' G gang, checking out Tec and the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him, ese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's Tec, homes, from the I-9's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Cyco, tell him to bring it all. We gonna have a party. The homeboy works his cell, as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands there with the phone in his hands, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's been kidnapped for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want five hundred grand or they'll kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's not panic. Lemme just think this through for a minute. We could have a very interesting opportunity here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the negatives are obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill drops out of the race, emotional distress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle Bill. Let's brainstorm the positives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's so many. No more 'Brad problem.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right, I'm liking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start riffing on the idea, getting excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a dead son, the sympathy factor could give us big spike in the female and gay demos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had such a problem with Bill's rich guy image, we could spin the issue to make him more 'Everymen,' you know, 'crime touches everyone,' like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a voter backlash, like how could he run on the heels of a tragedy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- we push the 'courage under adversity' angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helps with his leadership profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Gluckman, crusader/martyr...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the image -- Bill weeping over Brad's open casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, after grieving appropriately, he goes on the offensive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Gluckman's war on crime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... gangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War's hot now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just what we've needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a green light to Sacramento.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next stop, the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS and Tom picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Gluckman does not make deals with criminals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, then, fool. I ain't playin'. His ass is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what you have to do, and we'll do what we have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: A70 INDUSTRIAL STREET
dialogues.text: Tec hangs up; as he looks over, Brad is pulled from the trunk by two I-9s, his mouth still taped. Tec almost feels sorry for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cold. (to crew) Lose the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec's homie rips the tape off Brad's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn that hurts!!! I get out of this I'ma hafta teach y'all some manners!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy ain't payin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, tell me somethin' I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, you half-steppin' moist-ass bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec cocks his nine and aims at Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fearless) Oh what, you gonna do me like this? A'ight, then bring it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's brought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man up! Put this wannabe out of his misery.

dialogues.speaker: A70 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tec is stunned -- the white boy isn't showing any fear. Brad steps forward, puts the gun to his own heart, and places his thumb on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gat's real, right?    Then do it or I'll do it myself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unnerved) Brotha straight-up crazy, and I cannot deal with that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly GUNFIRE erupts as Tech's car is HIT with a BARRAGE of BULLETS. Brad, the crew, Sean and PJ drop to the street and roll under the car. Tec has to dive behind a nearby dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS STREET
dialogues.text: Snuffy and three Rollin' G's are crouched behind their low rider, FIRING away.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER CAR
dialogues.text: The I-9s RETURN FIRE. PJ and Sean are in the fetal position, freaking out. Brad, thinking it's all fake, is laughing, having a great time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay down some cover, fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec's pinned down behind the dumpster. He's without a weapon, and Rollin' G's are FOCUSING their FIRE on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're tryin', man, but they're too strapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punks.   Gimme dem gats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad grabs the Uzis and rolls out from under the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all wanna play? Let's play! You know who you're dealin' with???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps up on the hood of Tec's car and OPENS FIRE with both Uzis, laying down a withering rain of lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm B-Rad G, from the 'BU, y'all... (out Denzeling Denzel) King Kong ain't got nothin' on me! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. These special effects are the bomb! (resumes FIRING) Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rollin' G's try to respond, but Brad's fire is too intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil's got some balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real!   Let's dip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all hop in their convertible and tear-ass out of there as Brad jumps off the cars and follows on foot, FIRING after them as they turn the corner and SQUEAL away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's safe now, y'all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec emerges from behind the dumpster. The crew rolls out from under the car, followed by Sean and PJ. They look at Brad in awe. They're impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was ill!    Y'all definitely got juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers his fist to Brad.        They pound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn that shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.   Jus' MTV.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL FISHMAN reads the night's news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. A Channel Five exclusive. A security camera captured incredible footage of gang violence tonight, as it flared on the streets of South Central.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: of Brad, on top of Tec's car, FIRING the UZIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hardcore gangster, believed to be the notorious 'White Kong,' leader of I-9 street gang, fires his weapons with wanton disregard for human life or personal property.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD'S CRAZED FACE
dialogues.text: in SLOW MOTION as he FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have any information on the whereabouts of this man, call our hot line at 1-555-GANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in bed, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the couch, blocking a wig, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Mocha, Hadji, and Monster, holding half-drunken lattes, are all staring at a TV mounted in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Gaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: Tom stares at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaa... And then, in QUICK SHOTS, we INTERCUT BETWEEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oooooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oooooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oooooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oooooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oooooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... aaaaaad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dat is some hardcore shiznit, y'all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If dat's what you got to do to get on Big Boy's label, count me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't with Big Boy, fool! B- Rad's hangin' with some serious bangers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we gonna do, Moch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bounce to our respective cribs, jack our moms' and pops' biggest gats, jet down to South Central and save his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... what if they don't have coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista -- six Tsunamis to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill storms in. Tom quickly switches OFF the TV. staffers move aside as Bill confronts Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley's been involved in a gang shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face was on the news, Tom!   I think I know my own son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure there's a logical explanation. Why don't you get some sleep --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep? He's shooting the hell out of South Central. We've got to get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the debate tomorrow in Sacramento --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the debate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you cancel, you can kiss this campaign good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can shove the campaign up your ass, Tom! I will not lose my son over this election!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you're upset, Bill, but Jesus, for once in your life think outside the box! We can make Brad's whole gang thing a positive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) A positive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's arrested or, God forbid injured, we spin it so you are the victim, you know, 'crime reaches everyone,' something like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to get votes out of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to win, Bill, and you don't seem to care!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) When did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill grabs Tom by the shirt and slams him into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bill takes off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, guys, let's pitch on how I get my job back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, I never liked the way you ran things around here. (walking out) Bill? Mr. Gluckman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other staffers follow Brett out, leaving Tom alone.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bill hauls-ass down the 405, his headset on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lojack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a location on license number... (reluctant) 'D-SHIZNIT.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That vehicle is at the corner of McKinley and 82nd.

dialogues.speaker: ON DASH NAVIGATION SYSTEM SCREEN
dialogues.text: Suddenly a map of South Central appears, with a red blinking dot at the corner of McKinley and 82nd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your destination is a Lojack designated danger zone. Lojack does not recommend you venture into this area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAP BLASTS IN as Bill punches the gas, as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A party is happening: Homies slam dominoes... Home girlz drink beer and talk... Sean and PJ are standing frozen in a corner, quietly crying... Hip-hop gangsters dancing... and finally we FIND Tec and the other I-9's gathered around Brad, as Tec solemnly hands Brad a Tec 9 automatic pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's yours, B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?   You shouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the 9's.     Only way out now, is in a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a box... right. Brad laughs.   They all join in, laughing hard as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mocha, Hadji and Monster stand by Hadji's dad's Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, Monster, what kind of toast you strappin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This. Monster pulls a scuba divers' spear gun from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pop's spear gat. From the yacht. Mocha laughs and starts doing whale sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight Free Willy, think you so bad, what you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts an old musty case in the car and starts to close the doors. Hadji stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, a'ight, chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the case, revealing an antique blunderbuss musket, with a flintlock hammer and a bell muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a freakin' musket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  My pops is a collector. (off their looks) Come on, man, pirates used that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monster grabs the musket and points it at Mocha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating a pirate) Aargh, matey, give up yer treasure or I'll bust me harpoon in yer booty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monster and Hadji start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!   Damn posers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches the musket from Monster and carefully places it back in the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hadji, how 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't get much, yo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hadji opens a duffel and pulls out three Kevlar vests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I told my pops we was going on a drive-by, he gave me three of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking, but what heat you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a plastic case, revealing a Stinger rocket launcher and four missiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... dis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mocha and Monster are blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang!   Where'd you get all dat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Christmas present from Uncle Ahmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mocha, Hadji, and Monster snap on their seat belts. Hadji flips on the in-dash SOS Mercedes GPS system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Amiraslani, can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yes, chicken. I need a location on license number D- SHIZNIT.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is now in full effect, the system up and cranked as the CAMERA FINDS Brad's in the middle of the dance floor, freaking and doing the robot with a couple of sisters. The girls whisper in his ear, he smiles, and they head for a bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just as they exit, Shondra enters from the kitchen, and finds Sean and PJ, still tied up and terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Brad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near tears) I haven't seen anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves on.     PJ lifts up his bound wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra!   Little help, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's on the bed with the two women, who are kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just got tested positive ... for G.A.M.E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock surprise) Cool playa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh when suddenly Shondra comes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the same damn line he used on me, and now this no good deadbeat weak-ass white boy won't take care of little Malik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffles) You know he's yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gettin' heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, why you throwin' salt on my G.A.M.E.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm savin' your lily-white ass. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't goin' nowhere. I'm a I-9 neow, straight-up. Peep my tat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad lifts his shirt and shows her the tattoo on his stomach: I-9 THUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) Listen, fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Shondra! I know y'all set me up, I know it's all fake, de kidnap, de stickup, de whole nizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you play me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you need money Money?!   Tch. for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, fool, this may sound stupid to you, but not everybody has money, and to people that don't, money is important!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. You prob'ly still flippin' me anyway, so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Brad, this is real.   Tec and his crew are real --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really? Well if Tec is real then this gat must be real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad pulls his nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if this gat is real then the in it have got to be real. caps And seein' how my foot is real, this would really hurt... then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad aims at his foot and pulls the trigger and BLAM! puts a BULLET through the toes of his sneaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See dat. I just shot myself in the foot and... (feeling pain) It's reaaaaalll! It's totally reaaaaalll!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad starts hopping around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just shot my foot!!   I just shot my foot!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop hoppin' around, fool, so I can look at it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shondra gets down on her knees to get a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh gaawwwd!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky you're such a weak shot. Cap just grazed your toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, it's real, Shondra, it's all reeeeeeeeeeeeeeeal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec enters, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the hell's poppin' ca --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra, on her knees, kneeling before Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing) What up, cuz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra stands quickly, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified, covering) Ha ha, Tec, my road dawg, yeah, just the man I wanta see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shondra) What's goin' on, Shondra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) It's not what it looks like, Tec, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you lie to me. That was always my line to you, and it always was what it looked like. Now what's up with your boyfriend here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, dawg, love to kick it wit' you and run the whole thizang, but I got some bidness back in the 'Bu, li'l somethin' somethin' with Big Boy and whatnot, so if y'alls don't mind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec grabs Brad and drags him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Tec, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec hauls Brad in, followed by Shondra. The I-9s draw weapons; the room fills with tension. Sean and PJ look on, getting caught up in the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Tec, lemme explain, 'cause I don't belong here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done forgot already, fool? I told you the only one way out of the I-9s, and your 'E' ticket's in this here chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec cocks his gun.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND PJ
dialogues.text: watching Tec, riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how committed he is? That's the rage I was talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in awe) Word.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Tec aims at Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't be hatin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra steps in front of Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you do it, Tec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, then.   I'll just do the both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tec levels the barrel at Shondra and Brad. He starts to squeeze the trigger when suddenly Bill's HUMMER CRASHES through the wall. I-9's scatter and duck as the Hummer's front grill skids to a stop inches from Tec. The driver's door pops open and Bill jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn fool!   You just hit my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Brad!   Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. And unless you seriously strapped, you about to be not really okay too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill turns:     six I-9s are aiming guns at he and Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, fellas. Bill Gluckman... I'm running for governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know who you are, fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the candidate that's down with bitches and ho's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsss. Dude think we ignorant just 'cause we live down here. You better recognize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I absolutely recognize that street violence is tearing Californians apart... You see, guys, California is my family, and hey, here's a thought. Instead of thinking of ourselves as what set we're from, or what crew we're rolling with, why can't we just be brothers? What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtful) Hmmm. I guess I never looked at it like that before. What do you say, 'brothers'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The I-9's smile, cock their weapons, aim them, and just as they're about to start blasting, the side WALL EXPLODES and Hadji's dad's MERCEDES CRASHES through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't anybody know where the driveway's at?! Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gangsters fall back as Hadji, Mocha, and Monster jump out wearing the Kevlar vests and wielding their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) Better step, y'all, or I'ma have to waste all y'all up in this piece!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!   Drop yo gats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The I-9s, unafraid, point their guns right back at Hadji, Monster and Mocha. It's a multi-player Mexican standoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your gats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody does.     Brad steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold dup, y'all. Before anybody ices anybody I got to say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one stops him, so Brad turns to his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really weren't gonna pay my ransom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know anything about that. You've got to believe me, that was not part of the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the plan? Send me down here to scare me white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was stupid, I know. I thought I'd tried everything... I just didn't know how to deal with you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never known how to deal with me 'cause you don't know me, and you never cared to find out. And now that your election's on the line, that's when you take a stand? That's bullshit, Pops. Look at me, 'cause this is who I am, and if you can't accept that, then I'll walk out that door, never see your sorry-ass again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra, Tec, all the I-9's and Brad's posse slowly turn from Brad to Bill, completely caught in the moment, waiting for his response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not proud of myself, Brad. I made a lot of mistakes, and I know I wasn't there for you, and I can't change that, but I always loved you and still do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and if you say this is really who you are, then I believe you and accept you, and from here on in, I promise to be a real father to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk is cheap, Pops.    Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, ain't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad looks at him.        Bill looks back.   Everyone loo riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, Pops, we cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pound.

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTERS
dialogues.text: getting emotional.        A couple sniffle, a few wipe th eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere) Wish I could talk to my pops like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional) No doubt. He's raising his kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dialing his cell, wiping tears) I'ma call my pops right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would y'all get a hold of your fool selves?! It's time to waste these punks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The I-9s straighten up and re-aim their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with confidence) Tec, before we all go out in a blaze of glory, can I say one last thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Whatchya got to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moch, kick it freestyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mocha rests the musket in the crook of his arm, and does his human beat box thing as Brad begins to rap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'What's up with all this fightin'? We all should be unitin'! Y'all egos need deflatin', Gangstas, please, quit all this hatin'.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, please! If I hear you drop one more rhyme, I'ma hafta smoke myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, cool, but all these gats got to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brad grabs the missile launcher from Hadji...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved, earnest) Word up, B. All this hatin' is wack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mocha slams the butt of the musket down, and the flintlock slams forward. Everyone cringes. Nothing happens. Everyone looks at the MUSKET, then suddenly it EXPLODES and a rusty musket ball FIRES OUT, slamming Monster in the middle of her Kevlar breastplate. She flies back and slams into the wall, causing her spear gun to fire -- a SPEAR SHOOTS OUT and lands directly into Brad's left ass cheek. Brad howls and drops the MISSILE LAUNCHER... SLOW MOTION:     everyone watches it fall to the ground.. REAL TIME:     it hits the floor and the MISSILE FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brad... Tec... Bill... and Shondra all watch in horror as the missile flies past gang members, through the kitchen door, and slams into the side of the gas oven. We hear a countdown BEEP BEEP BEEP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruuuuuuunnnnn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone runs for the nearest hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies stream out of the house scrambling for safety when suddenly... The HOUSE BLOWS in a huge orange FIREBALL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CRANE PAST emergency vehicles parked in front of smoldering remains of Tec's house, then MOVE TO Tec, who is yelling at a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know my rights, man, and these fools drove two damn cars into my house, then they blew the shit up! This all better be rebuilt before my ma comes back, or she will make you wish you were never born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a FEMALE TV REPORTER speaking TO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two witnesses who were at the scene of the explosion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and the CAMERA WIDENS to include Sean and PJ; their clothes are singed and still smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell us what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was hard core, yo. All these crazy busters was strapped to the nines, and I was like, keepin' the peace, telling the brothers to talk it out, find their common bond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean steps in front of PJ, speaking directly INTO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going for the   Oscar) See, the explosion was   just a metaphor for the anger   we oppressed young men of   color have buried deep inside our   hearts... hearts turned dark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Okay, thank you, Bloodbath and Tree. (turns TO CAMERA) And all of this mayhem is rumored to have been caused by the mysterious White Kong, who remains at large. This is Soon Yi Baxter- Hernandez, reporting from South Central.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking normally) When's this gonna air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get a copy of this?     I need it for my reel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glares and they move off... We FIND Brad and Shondra by an ambulance, talking as a paramedic bandages Brad's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool... still a little confused maybe. I'm still not exactly sure what was for real and what wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as far as being real, I can only vouch for two things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him full on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can deal with a little more of that reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again, then Brad breaks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You said two things was real. What was the other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra smiles as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up, Shondra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an incredibly foofy Baroque nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you knew Big Boy the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we go way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Shondra tells me you drop rhyme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peep dis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands over a Mali-Bootay CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you hear my demo, you're gonna want to give me Eminem play, dawg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the CD) I can't wait, y'all. Peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Boy pounds Brad and they exit. Big Boy hands the CD to a British butler, who puts it in the system. Big Boy puts on the headphones and the butler hits play. Big Boy listens for a minute, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly what to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: A91 OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Boy stands there in his bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad's CD flies into the sky like a skeet clay pigeon. Big Boy raises a GLOCK and BLOWS it to kingdom come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad and Shondra stand off to the side of a huge rally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Twenty thousand people, all here to support my pops. He must have charisma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like father like son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra, girl. I just have to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the only one who accepted me for who I really am. (beat) You also car jacked me, kidnapped me and tried to turn me white, but I'm gonna let that go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss, tongues and all as Bill walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kids... Sorry to interrupt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) What up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm about to go on and, Brad... I want you to be part of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, be onstage with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to help me get the urban vote. Introduce me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang, I'd be honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, son, don't say it... (beat) Rap it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blown away) For real, Pops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real, son, for rizzeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra looks on proudly as MUSIC -- heavy on emotional strings, swells, driving the movie audience to feel as good as they've ever felt in a movie. Brad takes the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, y'all! I'm here to introduce you to my father, Bill Gluckman! The big Gluck!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rap beat kicks in as Brad goes all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all gather here on this special occasion. To listen to my pops, he's your west coast liaison. A speech from him, dude, is like sex with a hoochi. It's hot and excitin', like shoppin' at Gucci! Asians, Jews, Mexicans, too. Everybody's votin', yo, it's a cultural stew. Once he's in office you'll experience great riches. As a thank you for helpin', you can get wit my bitches! Let's get Glucked! Y'all get Glucked! We get Glucked! Come on everybody put your hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill moves onstage and attempts to dance hip hop style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immigration, education, and runaway inflation. It got me so stressed I need to start masturbatin'. California ain't flowin' like some ol' constipation. Vote for dad or I'll bash your frickin' face in! Come on everybody put your hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if my dad wins this election, he'll grow on y'all like a BAD VD INFECTION!! Yeeah! We all need a Gluckin'! Let's all get Glucked! GO GLUCK YOURSELF!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad raises Bill's hand up in victory and we FREEZE.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE: Brad did deliver the urban vote... to Bill's opponent. Bill Gluckman lost the election by a landslide.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE-FRAME TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE: Sean and PJ landed jobs more suitable to their talents... We WIDEN to reveal Sean and PJ in uniform and working at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We UNFREEZE.     Sean and PJ wait on a TEN-YEAR-OLD GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Wienie In A Bun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a Double Dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom leans in, with a "Manager" nametag, whispering angrily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push the Mega Meal, or you punks are so fired.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: sitting at their usual table, in mid-argument. SUPERIMPOSE: Mocha, Hadji and Monster continued to do nothing whatsoever, except for order coffee and argue...

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE ON TEC
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE: Tec sued Bill Gluckman, and was awarded 100 thousand dollars for damage to his house, and another thirty million for emotional distress. Tec moved...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: UNFREEZE:     to reveal Tec leaving his driveway in a Bentley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What up, neighbor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN TO Bill, in his Hummer, leaving his driveway.       H waves grumpily as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE: While waiting for his rap career to kick in, Brad invested his trust fund into a business that made sense. We CRANE DOWN FROM a sign that reads: "GRAND OPENING, SHONDRA'S NAIL AND BEAUTY SALON" to reveal a crowd of Malibu women gathered around Brad and Shondra as Shondra cuts a ribbon with a huge pair of scissors; the women rush inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I helped Shondra open up her salon right here in the 'Bu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra puts the finishing touches to a woman in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She styled up all the ladies in Malibu so they were stone-cold ghetto fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shondra spins the chair to REVEAL: BEES GLUCKMAN with a crazy ghetto hairstyle. She looks like Busta Rhymes. She checks herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it. (alternate) Boo-ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles revealing a GOLD TOOTH with a DIAMOND in it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: L.A.'s own, Hal Fishman reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's official. Bill Gluckman is California's next governor. We have a live report from the celebration at Gluckman headquarters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN TO the news monitor over Hal Fishman's shoulder, to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEERS, as Bill takes the mic (As he speaks, we SLOWLY PULL BACK, gradually revealing the people next to him on stage).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a monumental day for our glorious state and there are several people I need to thank here tonight... (beat) There's the International Brotherhood of Police Officers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE, as POLICE OFFICERS salute Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Southern California Rotary Club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table full of well-dressed PROFESSIONALS wave politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our friends at the Environmental Defense Fund...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of granola-type ENVIRONMENTALISTS smile. Brad CLEARS HIS THROAT, causing Bill to look at him. Brad gives Bill a "reminder" nod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO REVEAL:     We're actually in the PROUD BIRD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of factly) ... all the Bitches and Ho's...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A pod of SKANKY WOMEN snap their fingers in Bill's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pimps... The Hoodrats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lavishly-dressed PIMPS raise their canes to Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Association of Korean Grocers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ASIAN FAMILY give Bill the "thumbs-up."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Playas. The Ballers. The Shot Callers. And a special shout out to the I-9's.

dialogues.speaker: TEC
dialogues.text: and his gang.     They wear dark suits and do rags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... The Women's Organization of California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table full of prim ELDERLY LADIES golf-clap and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And most of all, I'd like to thank my campaign advisor on urban affairs, and my son, B-rad G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE as Brad grabs the mic at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West Coast Reprezzizzin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Brad hug. HIP HOP MUSIC KICKS IN and the entire       Ballroom turn one huge dance party. Bill raises the        roof as he meanders into the celebrating crowd.        People of all different races and backgrounds dance       together, all having a blast... Hadji grinds on an ELDERLY CONSTITUENT's ass... she's into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm totally taxing your ass.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bess compares her diamond ring to Tec's Bling-Bling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get that from Tiffany?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that was the Bitches' name, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to marvel at each other's decorative accessories...

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE IN THE PARTY
dialogues.text: We see Sean and PJ are caterers, wearing "Wiener on a Bun" outfits/hats and circulating among the guests. They approach a well-to-do PARTYGOER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care for a wiener? Courtesy of Wiener on a Bun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or perhaps I can interest you in a head shot? I'm trained in jazz dance, tap, and I can do a Southern accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom enters wearing a "Wiener on a Bun" manager's outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiots. What did I tell you about bothering the guests? Now move it, those wieners aren't serving themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes them out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, yo, yo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to see Brad still at the podium. Confusion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I was here, y'all threw my ass out. But now that I haves yo attention, I gots somethin' I gotta say... And I have to do it the only way I know how... Kick it, Moch.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEETH RATTLING BASS THUNDERS, as Brad pulls the mic out of the stand and begins prowling around the stage. (NOTE: Rap can be shortened.) SLOW MOTION:     Panic, as everyone realizes Brad is abou to rap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrote this one just for you, Dad. (starts to rap) Yeah, yeah. Oh yeah. Yeah, yeah... Yeah... (stops) I'm sorry, I lost my place again. (remembers) Oh, here we go... Election, erection, I got an infection. My pops, he won, Defying all the pre-dections...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and PJ (waiters) drop their serving trays; Tec and the I-9's dive for Brad at the podium; Shondra screams, "NOOOOOO"... Brad is grabbed and thrown off the stage by the I-9's and is projected out over the audience, where we... FREEZE ON:     Brad's terrified face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocky as ever) What can I say, ain't nothing but a thang...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNFREEZE and Brad falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After months of searching the Southland for notorious criminal White Kong, the LAPD has finally made an arrest. The suspect, a black man, was caught earlier today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footage of a BLACK MAN being put in a squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'White Kong'?    Damn! I'm not even white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they all say. (alternate:) Shut up, White Kong.
